ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: An interdisciplinary examination of iconoclasm and visual controversies. I would recommend to another student, particularly for students in Art History, Religion.

Yes, I would recommend this course to a fellow student. This course is worth taking if you are interested in doing a serious research paper on the visual and material cultures of religion and would like to develop some background knowledge on important episodes of the contestation of religious images in Europe and America.

This is an incredible class that I would recommend to everyone! that spans many periods of time, and many cultures, places, etc. It speaks of iconoclasm is a way that is diverse, just like the coursework. There are many interpretations of what iconoclasm is/was/can be, and the instructors provide amazing reading material, and thoughts during class about this topic, and sometimes topics that diverge slightly but are still related. I appreciate the instructors enthusiasm and engagement with the students, and uplifting and positive attitudes. Thank you!!!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: In found this course to helpful in developing my ability to think critically about the politics of vision and how that affects the diverse world of art and performance.

This course opened my eyes to the multitude of and complex ways people regard images. It was very helpful for me to consider how people relate to images, and objects, and it is something I am very regularly thinking about in relationship to my work. I am so happy I took this class!
